top_comment.text:
I've had dreams that seemed more real than this so called reality, the 
properties of physics relating to that dream world seemed to be in sync or 
at least conductive to that which I needed or wanted to achieve by pure 
will power. All my dreams are like that. Growing up I learned to control 
and manage, understand the way things work in the dream reality and little 
by little I have evolved to a state that when I dream, I no longer need to 
go about things as I would try on earth. I used to run, then leap far, then 
fly and now I just WILL myself where and when I need to be in my dream. 
Even flying seems slow and out dated way of travel compared to the speed of 
travel via instant thought. I no longer apply the physics of earth to my 
life in the dream, but instead have learned an entire new way of being. I 
am not only aware that time and matter are simple an Illusion but can 
manipulate both at will in order to fix or correct events or dream 
trajectories i am not pleased with. When i wake up usually, this reality 
seems antique, as if I was waking up to a reality of limitations, 
inconsistencies, biased laws of physics, just a watered down, downgraded 
version of the other reality I call dreams. I have a parallel life that I 
go to when I sleep, and Its amazing, it takes living this one here on earth 
in order to value and appreciate the other. Its a place that seems like 
earth but its one with you and you are one with it, it responds to you and 
facilitates anything you desire by just Willing it to happen with absolute 
trust. For example on earth here, you must make things happen but external 
work and force one bit at a time, the elements will not work with you, 
matter is not under your mental command. In the dream world everything is 
connected and there is no need for brute force, Imagination is amplified as 
a form of vision and matter is at your command. Pain and death are also 
simple illusions there, if you believe you can die, you will and then wake 
up, but if you know for fact that you are immortal in the dream world then 
no matter what you just dont die, in fact in my experience, the episodes 
that used to relate to dying have stopped after i repeatedly defeated them 
by simply refusing to die, knowing I cant be killed. its very interesting, 
and this goes for other challenges in the dream world, one I master a 
concept I rarely experience it again, instead the level of difficulty and 
trickiness increases, as if trying to test me in other ways to see if I 
have truly mastered the idea or not. Its cool, i don't know why it happens 
but I'm grateful it does. My most amazing experiences in this life have 
been the ones I have had in the dream world. Nothing comes close on earth. 
Its like comparing the game play of a PS4 to a old 8 bit Atari. I wish I 
could dream 24/7.        ﻿
top_comment.author: Ford Windsor SVT

comments.text:
+Dr.Z~ One Thank you I'll look into it, and I agree with this life actualy 
being a Dream of our own Creation, we dont know it but our higher self is 
the player or creator of this life. it seems that we have a higher self, 
much like we play a video game with a favorite character, one that we 
customize to our liking, it would seem this is could be a good example of 
how life is really. Scientists have discovered many almost 98% of our 
actions ans thoughts come from somewhere else beyond the brain, we act out 
what we think we think, but in reality the impulse and master thought or 
overriding will come from some place else and we only follow it, its all 
with in fractions of micro seconds but its detectable. So in fact I wonder 
are we simply a character of our higher self playing a game.
comments.author: Ford Windsor SVT

Travel,' now I think it's referred to as a 'New Age Religion,' but don't 
let that freak you out. If you'd delve into it a bit, you might realize

further One's Spiritual development! Perhaps ultimately One may realize, 
that This world is actually the Dream, of our own Creation! ☺

comments.author: Holly K

comments.text:
+Jefferson50275 The world as a dream concept has been around for thousands 
of years. I really don´t think it is a belief. It is more like a metaphor 
(a figure of speech in which a term or phrase is applied to something to 
which it is not literally applicable in order to suggest a 
resemblance). Dreaming is an experience that we know in our dualistic life, 
and, by referring to our life experience as a dream, mystics are pointing 
to the similarity of the unreality of our experience on earth, to the ever 
changing forms we experience, to the hallucinatory nature of our 
experience,  and even to the fact that the characters and stories in the 
dream are projected from our unawakened mind.
comments.author: Jorge Leite

comments.text:
Thanks for sharing! I like Alan Watts. This world-as-dream idea has been 
around a very, very long time, hasn't it? I think it can potentially be as 
harmful as helpful, as all beliefs can be, similar to how Jesus refers to 
reincarnation in the Course's teacher manual. It can certainly be a useful 
tool to help us loosen our attachments and help us forgive the world we 
see. It can also be used to delay, justify wrong-mindedness, distantiate, 
etc...it seems to me that the belief, like all things, boils down to what 
it is for, what it's purpose is, because that determines what it will be 
used for.
"Once upon a time I dreamt I was a butterfly, fluttering hither and 
thither, to all intents and purposes a butterfly. I was conscious only of 
my happiness as butterfly, unaware that I was Chou. Soon I awaked, and 
there I was, veritably myself again. Now I do not know whether I was then a 
man dreaming I was a butterfly, or whether I am now a butterfly, dreaming I 
am a man. Between a man and a butterfly there is necessarily a distinction. 
The transition is called the transformation of material things." ~Chuang 
Tzu (c. 369 BC – c. 286 BC)
comments.author: Jefferson50275

captions.text: I wonder

I wonder what you would do if you had
the power to dream
at night any dream you wanted to dream

and you would of course be able to alter
your time sense
and sleep say seventy five years

of subjective time into eight hours of
sleep

and you would naturally as you
began

on this adventure of dreams you would
fulfill all your wishes
you would have
every kind of pleasure you could conceive
love affairs
banquets dancing girls
wonderful journey, gardens
music beyond belief

and then after a couple a months of this
sort of thing at 75 years a night

you would be getting a little taste for
something different

and you would move over to an
adventurous dimension

where there were sudden dangers involved
and the thrill of
dealing with dangers

and you could rescue princesses from
dragons
and go on dangerous journeys
make wonderful explosions and blow them up
eventually get into contest with enemies
and after you've done that
for some time
you'd think up a new wrinkle
to forget that you were dreaming

so that you would think it was all for
real
and to be anxious about it
and then, 'cos it'd be so great when you woke up
and then you'd say well
like children
who dare each other on things
how far out could you get
what could you take
what dimension of being lost
of abandonment of your power what dimension of that could you stand
you could ask yourself this because you know you would eventually wake up
then you would get
more and more adventurous
finally you would dream where you are now

you would dream the dream of living the life
that you actually living today

that would be within the infinite
multiplicity

of choices that you would have so in this
idea then
everybody is fundamentally the
ultimate reality not God

in a politically kingly sense but God
in the sense of being the self
that deep down basic whatever there is

and you're all that only you're pretending
you're not

title: Is this life a Dream? (Inception version) - Alan Watts
